info.title: Jarred's Calculator
info.description: A simple web calculator that logs what it does.

get.summary: Lists all calculations that are logged.
get.description: Retrieves the logs for calculations, with optional filtering and sorting, and displays them, formatted as JSON

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A filter that only looks at data from the given user id or ip address, or the current user if it equals 'current'.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Sorts the data by the given value.

parameters.name: sortby
parameters.description: Sorts the data by the given value. It functions identically to the orderby parameter. If they contradict, behavior is undefined.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: If orderby or sortby is specified, this may be used to specify which direction to order. It must be either ASC or DESC

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specifies which page number to retrieve. If not specified or negative, it retrieves all values.

parameters.name: pagesize
parameters.description: Specifies the number of entries per page.

403.description: You have not gotten a session token. Please GET /api.php/token to get one.

parameters.name: entry
parameters.description: JSON-encoded data containing the operation and result and properties of the root object.

Location.description: The location at which the logged calculation can be reviewed.

400.description: Something was wrong with your arguments.

get.summary: Performs the given calculation and gives the result.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: The name of the operation to execute

parameters.name: firstNumber
parameters.description: The first number on which to operate.

parameters.name: secondNumber
parameters.description: The second number on which to operate. This is ignored if the operation is unary.

200.description: Successful, returned the requested operation and the result, formatted in a more user-friendly way (i.e. Add/1/2 becomes 1+2=3)

400.description: The operation requires three or more operators.
